website_summaries.verdict: The Microsoft Wireless Display Adapter faces some serious competition in the form of the Chromecast and Roku sticks, but could find a home with travelers and business people who rely on Windows 8.
pros: Setup is simple and quick, if your devices are up-to-date
It uses standard Miracast technology that works with Windows computers and some Android devices, without needing a traditional Wi-Fi network
cons: Similar devices, including Google's Chromecast, cost less
Be prepared to bring your own power supply if you don't have a powered USB port on your monitor

customer_reviews.title: I am really disappointed of this device
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed of this device,its lags , it freezes , it disconnect constantly,I am using it on a ASUS Monitor and connecting it with the surface pro 3 with windows 10 .And for now ,all i got is a bad experience , easy set up but the performance its bad.
customer_reviews.author: Rxtec

customer_reviews.title: Product and Seller are Awful! Saving you a hassle!
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't work at all even when the firmware was updated, can't keep up with presentations/videos/ pretty much nothing. On top of that it disconnects every ~3min or so, and the support from the seller is a joke. They said that they will send me a replacement, which after ~2 months I haven't received. If you don't want to be dealing with returns and that kind of BS, please get another product - such as this one
customer_reviews.author: Pats L.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and works good too!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. Since I have all my platforms using Windows, I felt it best to buy a Microsoft product that should work well together. It is so easy to connect and works every time. I had a Netgear PTV 3000 device that continually stopped working, dropped or wouldn't connect. Downloading its drivers was nothing short of impossible. The Micorsoft Wireless Display Adapter is so easy. However, it does have one drawback, specs say up to 23 feet but in reality less than 15 feet is the best. Since I have a small house, this was fine. Other than that, I highly recommend this product for Windows users.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for every house
customer_reviews.text: I recently installed this on my 60" screen TV. I own a Surface Pro 3 which I'm using to connect to the device via Miracast. A number of times I've been wanting to explain things to my kids on a whiteboard, and now I can do that with this adapter and my SP3 with any drawing software. I can also watch TV episodes from XfinityTV on my TV using my browser and it's pretty cool. I also own a Chromecast, but it limits me to what I can do. This adapter is way better. Recommend anyone that gets this to download the Windows Store app to manage the adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work With Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: This wireless display adapter does a great job casting your pc to your tv, however it is not compatible and was not designed for Windows 10. If you have Windows 8 this product is a no brainer excellent product. I had it working for a while under Windows 10 by updating my display and wireless drivers, but on the very next Windows update Microsoft released the connection to the device failed, that's why I'm giving this a 4 star vs 5 because Microsoft should be coordinating with their various departments making sure their products are compatible with their operating systems. Other than that it's the best wireless display adapter I've come across.
customer_reviews.author: I. Radas

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was expecting. I bought mainly to view movies and shows on my hard drive. Using Windows 10 on a new Toshiba Satellite, it took awhile to download firmware, configure, and connect. The instructions say 'works best when computer is within 20 feet' mine is four feet away, but signal is interrupted if you pass between TV & computer. Video quality is fair/poor on a newer Samsung TV - signal lags gets jerky or pixilates when changing shows, fast forwarding, and pausing. If you are buying for video, I would suggest a different product...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your TV has horizontal HDMI plugs or may not fit.
customer_reviews.text: The adapter is so long that when plugged into the HDMI plug on my tv it smashed against the frame of the tv so it broke in short order. The HDMI plugs on my tv are vertical and that's why it didn't fit well. Before it broke it worked real well with my windows phone and was easy to connect. If your tv has an HDMI plug that is horizontal it shouldn't be an issue. I tried another brand of adapter and had the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Twoshoes

customer_reviews.title: Great accesory
customer_reviews.text: Works superb, in a Vacuum I had it for a few days didn't test it out much until today I showed moms and my boy what my surface can do and it ran extremely smooth, and the edge browser has this Monday night football type play call were u can write on any website or any part of image of the URL and its very nice. Snapping screens on a 12' tablet is great but seeing it on a big screen TV was even better!!!
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft's new strategy: Reinstall every time you need something
customer_reviews.text: This device has such potential and such a letdown. It constantly disconnects, it's slow, and honestly, it's something I can barely tolerate for just a few minutes if I have to work on it. If you're doing a presentation, it can be slightly better, but even then, expect disconnects. The technology simply isn't there yet. As for the drivers and connections internally to the Surface, I suppose if you like removing and reinstalling all the time, this device is for you. It's not a matter of drivers or firmware to make it better. It really is that bad. 2 stars because it functions some of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Wait for the next model, March 1st
customer_reviews.text: Good product. You have to update the firmware by using the Wireless Display Adapter app only available on the Windows App Store (and thus only available on Windows 8.1 or 10). Otherwise works good, especially for presentations. There is still a little lag however, and starts to breakup and lose connection if you get around 15-20 feet away. One other thing to keep in mind, Microsoft is coming out with a new model for $50 starting March 1st. It's available for preorder on the Microsoft Store website. Might be worth waiting for the new one
customer_reviews.author: Jonny B

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful way to send video from your tablet to your TV via Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful extension for your PC. I use it with my Surface 3 Pro tablet. I just plug in the unit into the TV HDMI port, and the TV USB port. Nothing special is needed on the computer. Then a Bluetooth-enabled PC can cast its sound and video to that device. I've used it at a public meeting to show a video from my tablet, and I use it at home so that everyone can share looking at vacation pictures. I've also used it to use my computer monitor as a big screen for the tablet.
customer_reviews.author: LastGas

customer_reviews.title: this one has worked great since day one
customer_reviews.text: I got this device after having a lot of trouble with the similar one from Netgear. To my pleasant surprise, this one has worked great since day one. I use my Windows 10 laptop to project, and most of the time it is a great, reliable experience. There have only been a couple of times where the sound and the video were out of sync, but that seemed to be content-specific, i.e. watching other content did not exhibit the problem. This device is perfect for the "hey I saw this cool video today, let me show it to you on the TV" scenario.
customer_reviews.author: OkeyPlus

customer_reviews.title: connect every time you start and it freezes a lot...especially since it was updated...
customer_reviews.text: it worked better, i think before i updated the firmware on it. cuts out quite often so i have to disconnect and reconnect. I still have yet to find a way for it to connect automatically when i start up my system.
customer_reviews.author: Astra Porta

customer_reviews.title: Bad for Multimedia. Okay for Powerpoint or Word.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy setup but it stutters on 720 and 1080p video and the amount of choppiness makes it unusable for any movies. Also the colors are quite poor with the blacks being more grey and the gradations looking very rough (and this is definitely not the fault of the TV since I've played the same movies through my wired connection with no problem). You could use it as a desktop extender for word processing and powerpoint, so I won't give it 1 star; however, multimedia stuff is out of the question so I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: DontHateMe;HateTheProduct

customer_reviews.title: A great addition. Very easy to use... when it works
customer_reviews.text: I've been taking this on business trips. When it works it's fantastic. Just plug it in to the TV/Projector and away you go. So easy (when it works). I find that the connection drops intermittently about 10-20% of the time. This is unacceptable when I'm presenting or demoing our products. Our last meeting was very important so I elected not to use this. By that action alone made me lose faith in the product. I have only tried this on one of our laptops (new Dell XPS) so there may be a chance that it's not the adapter at all. Will check this and change review if that's the case.
customer_reviews.author: A M.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product for Microsoft devices
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for Microsoft devices. I use it regularly for displaying from my Surface to a VGA or HDMI screen. It works great and in my environment from about 100 feet away. It used to work on Android but for some reason no longer does, do your own research. and of course it will not work with Apple devices.
customer_reviews.author: MCB

customer_reviews.title: BEST THING EVER!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I live out in the country, so most internet providers have a data limit until you're charged an arm and a leg for just an extra gig. customer_reviews.author: Akio

After retrying several times it finally downloaded and ran the app. Instructions to make it connect were for a touch screen computer, which I do not have. Finally went to settings/devices/add a device. It actually started to try to connect. After a few minutes it said it failed. I give up. Time to find a good product.

customer_reviews.title: will be great when they work the kinks out.

I've used other miracast and it has been a pain to pair or baggy. This one is money. Love it. I've owned for around 2 years now, and it stopped working effectively after maybe 3 months.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: This works great with my Android phone and Windows laptops. I didn't notice any lags in the video. Sometimes the video from my phone would stutter but it not the fault of the display adapter. My phone is constantly running apps in the background which affects the video. I didn't give it five stars because I could not get my wife's Iphones and Samsung Galaxy Tab to work. I think they both use a different system or software to connect wirelessly to the tv.
customer_reviews.author: Romelio Rondaris

customer_reviews.title: The adapter half worked...
customer_reviews.text: It worked ok on my Windows 8.1 tablet, but does not work on my Samsung tablet. One of the reason for purchasing this item so I could use it with the Samsung tablet. If you are using Windows product I would recommended it, as for any Android product you may want to contact the maker of your Android tablet or phone to be sure it will work.
customer_reviews.author: RRD

customer_reviews.title: just like at work
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! This little thing really works. Put it on my 70" Vizio and connected to my new Toshiba laptop. Two screens, just like at work, but in my easy chair. Sorry, it's not intuitively obvious how this works, so you should spend about 37 seconds reading about how to connect it and then maybe 42 seconds creating shortcuts so it is really easy to reconnect, but you will love it if your setup is compatible with it. Awesome for us Geeks.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I plugged both ends into the Receiver. It has front HDMI and USB, so that was easy! No problem with the lower power output of the HDMI. Minimal delay, but otherwise love it! Best travel item I have bought! In fact, I use it at home quite a bit. I have only connected my Surface Pro 3 to it, so I can not speak to the connections with other devices. I get HD audio and HD video!
customer_reviews.author: NeoUnity

customer_reviews.title: Pretty handy to have, not good enough to rely on all the time

It does have a tendency to just get too hot and then shut off if you are presenting for more than 15-20 minutes but I'm not sure what you could change for that. The problem has been that it disconnects the wireless display and every once in a while, you can't get it to reconnect. This also was interfering with a Logitech wireless mouse that I had but purchasing a new mouse (Surface Arc and a New Logitech Mouse) both seem to work great (the Arc can get a little glitchy at times).
customer_reviews.author: Jess Bishop

customer_reviews.title: This device is too finicky for professional use. It ...
customer_reviews.text: This device is too finicky for professional use. It drops out for no apparent reason; when using with PowerPoint, it tears between the slides. Updating the firmware doesn't help any. The audio/video reproduction is okay when it displays correctly, but the intermittent dropping out and tearing wastes the hours put into producing a presentation. It probably would be okay for home use to cast your tablet screen to a TV.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea that simply does not work
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product,and attached it to a 55" television. Since then it worked one time. I have been as close as 3' and still no joy. I tried using this device with a new Dell laptop and properly equipped Dell tablet (the Venue). Back to the trusty, less expensive but don't count on it working. HDMI cable. Too bad that theory in technology does not always prove that it works.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis N Surprise

customer_reviews.title: I have heard it's great for watching movies
customer_reviews.text: I have tried this product with two computers and there is a noticeable lag that keeps me from using it as a second monitor. I have heard it's great for watching movies, but that was not my intention when buying this adapter. I have updated the firmware on the device, the software on my computer, lowered the resolution, used only the "one monitor" option and tried several strategies suggested online through various boards. No luck. Still laggy.

customer_reviews.title: Very unreliable connection with Surface Pro 4

Just try again and again and it will connect. And when it connects, it can drop anytime when you are still using your Surface Pro in a presentation. Reason? Nothing. Connect it again and it will let you go on for another 5-7 minutes. Hopeless product.
customer_reviews.author: Luan Ngo-Tran

customer_reviews.title: Very annoying. I think I will return it to Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I connected it per the instructions to my big screen Vizio TV, and tried to watch a one hour you-tube video using my new ASUS win 10 laptop. It would play well for a few minutes then it cause the computer to disconnect from the internet, causing me to have to reset everything and restart the connection between the computer and the TV. Very annoying. I think I will return it to Amazon. I had much better luck with my older widi connection using the same TV and a Windows 7 laptop from HP. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Henry C. Markwart

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about this, but not bad so far...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to watch football on our tv but my team went network by the time i got it. Now i use it to watch our church's sermons from home. The pastor doesn't move much, but when he does there is noticeable pixellation, so I'm expecting football to be a let-down on this thing. Easy to connect, and connects most of the time...
customer_reviews.author: D&K

customer_reviews.title: It works great for presentations with Power Point etc
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with a new Surface Pro 3. It works great for presentations with Power Point etc. The wireless part of it is awesome. It has a bit of lag though and video quality is very choppy. If you have presentations with video this will not work for you. It would be better to go hardwired for your presentation.
customer_reviews.author: Jerico

customer_reviews.title: This product works great with the surface pro 3 - If you don't ...
customer_reviews.text: This product works great with the surface pro 3 - If you don't have a USB on your TV you can USE your cell phone charger USB and an extension cord. the USB only provides power to the unit. once installed just put the TV on the correct INPUT you installed it into, and then on your surface or Device look for display adapter and it will show up , click on it and your now mirroring your display!
customer_reviews.author: J. F.

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: I have a surface 3 and totally wanted to check this out so i bought it. It is really easy to setup. So not only does the Video get sent to this display so does the audio which is very cool. Now for the down side, the connectivity with the device is not great. I have not had one sessions where i didn't have to reconnect at least twice which is frustrating. Overall it's a great idea and does work. Doing powerpoint presentations this works great.
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: Nice miracast adapter
customer_reviews.text: Works on some but not all devices I tried (only tried there androids and one iPad. 2 of the androids were not connecting (the more recent 5.0 and higher lolipop phones than the android tablet that connected no problem). IPad worked fine. I did not yet try to flash the Rom of this adapter which should solve the problem with the newer androids. Where it works the sound and video are perfect and show zero lag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and widely cross compatible
customer_reviews.text: I use it with my laptop, my Galaxy Note 12.2, Galaxy S5, and several friends devices as well. The biggest issue I have run into as of yet is not with this device, it is with all the tablets, laptops etc. as they usually need to have their drivers updated to support wireless display. It is my favorite 1080p wireless display adapter, and works with nearly all my devices.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel R. Landers

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with my Microsoft Surface Pro 3
customer_reviews.text: Allows me to expand my desktop on my Microsoft Surface Pro 3 onto my larger TV which helps a lot while doing my work. It connected very easily with my Surface but only connects about 80% of the time with my Samsung Galaxy S5 Active. All in all, I would highly recommend this to anyone who wants to mirror your screens to a larger TV.
customer_reviews.author: Jeeper

customer_reviews.title: Good Device. Has its kinks, but it wasn't made to make mistakes so make sure you don't.
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty well for me. It might cut-out sometimes or have its own issues, but I think it is fairly effective at what it attempts to accomplish. Transfers audio and video, 1080p quality and above. Make sure you turn the sound all the way up on your device before you connect it or you'll have to troubleshoot disconnecting and reconnecting to get it to reconnect if you disconnect just to increase the sound on the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M.

customer_reviews.title: Alright device for extremely casual use
customer_reviews.text: Product was skipping audio from less than 2 feet away from my projected device (surface pro 3). Also was not expecting to not have 60hz on a 1080p screen. Nowadays that's almost unacceptable, especially for the price-tag of the device.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works, but there may be a glitch.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. However, I had a significant glitch when I used it the first time. After using it plugged into an LG tv for an hour, the stream was interrupted. I could not establish the stream again. Restarted everything, still didn't work. Came home and tried it on my LG tv at home, could get it to stream. A couple of weeks later, I decided to give it another try, and it worked. Still can't figure out what happened. Oh, and it all happened 31 days after I ordered it, just after the merchant return period ended. I was using a Surface 2 pro, running Windows RT. Haven't tested it on a laptop with a full featured Windows OS.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: Works very well if your TV doesn't come with Miracast. you need an HDMI port on your TV and preferably an USB port to power it, but if not you can use an external 1amp USB charger to charge it. I've used it with my Galaxy S5, a couple of laptops and my Surface Pro 3. It uses WiFi to transmit the video signal, works well with movies and games so has pretty good signal.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: This item worked the first time I tested it out ...
customer_reviews.text: This item worked the first time I tested it out with a movie on my Microsoft Pro 3 laptop while I was waiting for cable to be installed in my new apartment. 3 months later I go to use it to repeat the same test (watchinga movie). It shows every indication that the devices were synced and even receieved a message on my TV saying "connected". I tried to return it but since it was past the 30 day return policy I was unable to do anything with and now I'm stuck with a $50 product that worked once.
customer_reviews.author: PMW

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great wireless option for Windows.
customer_reviews.text: Does great at times but then suffers from choppy video other times. From what I read, it can interfere with WiFi networks around you. Usually a restart on my Surface Pro 3 helps (along with a router restart), but it can be a hassle. It was much more consistent when I first got it, so I think it comes down to restarting hardware to allow for things to "start over". Best option I have found so far other than hooking up a HDMI directly.
customer_reviews.author: Lkosc

customer_reviews.title: The Only Way to Cast Your Computer Screen to Your TV.
customer_reviews.text: Great Wireless reeiver for my TV. I can not put what in on my Computer screen onto the TV with Miracast and it does work very well. I had been tied to using something that needed a browser, not I can cast anything to the screen. Great for Demo's. Will also work to add a 3rd monitor to your setup if needed - without wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Riker

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work like it said it would
customer_reviews.text: so far I haven't been able to do anything with this, doesn't work like it said it would, IM in the same room with device and still keeps searching for my tablet. not impressed so far. the one time I did get it to work somewhat it was so delayed im reaction. sorry not worth it. I will keep trying and let you know the results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: Does the job most of the time although image quality is not perfect. The cast image shows moving horizontal bands - distracting but not overwhelming. Pairing is sometimes finicky.
customer_reviews.author: N34578

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works with my Dell Venue Pro 11 and Dell U3415W monitor in the HDMI port. Worked with my Samsung Galaxy Tab Pro 12, but had some difficulty connecting. Gets a bit hot which leaves me concerned with it's longevity. I may elect to use a male to female adapter cable on the usb side so I can pull it out when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Cotrone (WeeboTech)

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Display Tech done right
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Purchased on a recommendation from a coworker and could not be happier. I use in conjunction with my Android smartphone and my Dell XPS Laptop and it works seamlessly to cast my wireless display on the screen. Most of the wireless display adapters on the market require a custom receiver AND transmitter, this guy works with the wireless display functionality built into windows 8 and 10. Your video card and wireless card have to be compatible though, so older PCs wont work.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mims

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. A bit pricey but well worth it. Reviewing it after some use and subtracting one star. Reason: When connected, which may take some time until it is recognized from the pc (SP3) turning on and off Bluetooth and disabling projected display, it only allows resolutions up to 1080 @ 30Hz. There is no option in the display adapter settings to increase refresh rate to 50Hz or 60Hz.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Fotis

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid adapter at good price
customer_reviews.text: Once I updated the BIOS on my Venue 8 Pro it worked like a champ. I love that it supports both Miracast and WiDi type of devices. I was able to connect it to my Laptop as well. It was really easy to configure from an adapter standpoint; the end devices with Miracast and/or WiDi take some technical knowledge to setup, but once you get that configured it connects everytime. Movie streaming was good quality, dragging windows across the screen and scrolling pages was about as laggy as you would expect with a wireless adapter, certainly not worth complaining over.
customer_reviews.author: John C Gallucci

customer_reviews.title: Initially i had a really bad experience; choppy playback
customer_reviews.text: Initially i had a really bad experience; choppy playback, screen corruptions and disconnecting but when I placed it to sit flat and plugged its USB power connector into a good quality charger all the issues disappeared and it is now functioning better than I had ever expected... Totally happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: works great for static stuff
customer_reviews.text: works great for static stuff, got it for my daughter's HP Stream 7, to stream her movies, halfway into the movie it does starts to lag, but I can't be 100% sure it's the adapter, as the tablet is also on the under-power side... lets just say, it works when it wants to
customer_reviews.author: Mest

customer_reviews.title: It worked great to begin with
customer_reviews.text: It worked great to begin with, but became less and less reliable. I've had it for about 3 weeks and now it does not connect to any of my devices at all. It gets hot, but not hot enough to damage most electronics. I went through all trouble shooting steps with my devices to include windows updates, and on one, a factory reset. No dice. The extra star is for a seamless return process and the fact that it got me through 24 sessions of Cowboy Bebop before it pooped the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Updated Display Adapter Drivers, downloaded app and BINGO!
customer_reviews.text: Had problems upon startup, laptop would connect and disconnect within 30 seconds. I found this worked for me on a Lenovo Z70 with Windows 8.1 upgraded to Windows 10. Went to Device Manager and updated driver software in both display adapters, then went to Windows Store and downloaded recommended app and bingo it works great on a Samsung smart TV.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected and does just what I wanted it to do. All I wanted was to be able to cast the image of my computer to the TV wirelessly and that is exactly what this allows. Simple and easy plug and play. I did have to download an app to my computer which was free and works with Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: DwaynePip

customer_reviews.title: Cool but wired is still better
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my Lumia Icon and Windows Mobile 10, quite a bit of lag though, so difficult to do anything but watch video with it. product_meta.title: Microsoft Wireless Display Adapter v1
product_meta.description: Share what's on your tablet, laptop, or smartphone on an HDTV or monitor with the Microsoft Wireless Display Adapter. Stream movies, view personal photos, or display a presentation on a big screen - all wirelessly. It uses Miracast technology, so you're not limited to certain apps or content streaming; you can display everything from your device. Just plug the USB and HDMI from the Wireless Display Adapter into your HDTV or monitor, connect, then mirror or extend your screen and enjoy. System Requirements Computer/Operating System: All Miracast enabled Windows 8.1 tablets/laptops/phones and Android devices with 4.2.1 and later. Internet access not required for use. Note: ensure the latest Windows updates are installed Miracast enabled Android devices 4.2.1 and later" Full functionality not available with non HDCP devices. If a device was originally pre-installed with a prior version of Windows (Windows 8, Win7, Vista or XP), please contact the OEM (original equipment manufacturer) to confirm if it is Miracast enabled. Not compatible with Surface RT.
